name: Secure Application
description: This app interfaces with Secure Application to add, delete and update policies defining what runtime behaviors to ignore, detect, or block. The app connects to the cloud version of Secure Application.

base_url.description: Base URL for accessing Secure Application APIs
base_url.name: base_url

account_id.description: Account Name, first part of SAAS URL Host Name
account_id.name: account_id

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Create a policy for an attack or vulnerability at runtime
actions.verbose: Create and configure runtime policy to specify an action to mitigate the attacks and vulnerabilities. To create policies, you require the Configure permission for Secure Application. By default, Secure Application includes a runtime policy that provides the best detection of all the attacks and vulnerabilities, reducing the false positives. There can be only one policy of each type for a given combination of application, tier, and tenant.

application_id.description: Application that includes the tiers or services on which you require to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
application_id.name: application_id
application_id.nameErrorText: Parameter names should be lowercase and have words separated by underscores.Only alphanumeric and underscore allowed.

tier_id.description: Application-specific tier to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
tier_id.name: tier_id

default_action.description: Default action for this policy. You can select IGNORE for no notifications for the runtime activity; select DETECT to detect the runtime activity; select BLOCK to block a specific runtime activity. Default value is "DETECT"
default_action.name: default_action

enable_policy.description: Select Yes/No to enable/disable the policy
enable_policy.name: enable_policy

actions.action: create new policy for http transaction header
actions.description: Create a policy for headers in HTTP transactions
actions.verbose: Create and configure runtime policy to detect or add a specific HTTP header to each HTTP response. The default action is detect. Specify which headers to add with the patch option. To create policies, you require the Configure permission for Secure Application. By default, Secure Application includes a runtime policy that provides the best detection of all the attacks and vulnerabilities, reducing the false positives. There can be only one policy of each type for a given combination of application, tier, and tenant.

application_id.description: Application that includes the tiers or services on which you require to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
application_id.name: application_id
application_id.nameErrorText: Parameter names should be lowercase and have words separated by underscores.Only alphanumeric and underscore allowed.

tier_id.description: Application-specific tier to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
tier_id.name: tier_id

default_action.description: Default action for this policy. You can select IGNORE for no notifications for the runtime activity; select DETECT to detect the runtime activity; select BLOCK to block a specific runtime activity. Default value is "DETECT"
default_action.name: default_action

enable_policy.description: Select Yes/No to enable/disable the policy
enable_policy.name: enable_policy

action for Strict-Transport-Security.description: Action for Strict-Transport-Security header. Default value is "DETECT"
action for Strict-Transport-Security.name: action_for_strict_transport_security

patch value for Strict-Transport-Securit.description: Value to patch for Strict-Transport-Security header. This value is applicable only if the action chosen is "PATCH"
patch value for Strict-Transport-Securit.name: patch_value_for_strict_transport_security

action for X-Frame-Options.description: Action for X-Frame-Options header. Default value is "DETECT"
action for X-Frame-Options.name: action_for_x_frame_options

patch value for X-Frame-Options.description: Value to patch for X-Frame-Options header. This value is applicable only if the action chosen is "PATCH"
patch value for X-Frame-Options.name: patch_value_for_x_frame_options

action for X-XSS-Protection.description: Action for X-XSS-Protection header. Default value is "DETECT"
action for X-XSS-Protection.name: action_for_x_xss_protection

patch value for X-XSS-Protection.description: Value to patch for X-XSS-Protection header. This value is applicable only if the action chosen is "PATCH"
patch value for X-XSS-Protection.name: patch_value_for_x_xss_protection

action for X-Content-Type-Options.description: Action for X-Content-Type-Options header. Default value is "DETECT"
action for X-Content-Type-Options.name: action_for_x_content_type_options

patch value for X-Content-Type-Options.description: Value to patch for X-Content-Type-Options header. This value is applicable only if the action chosen is "PATCH"
patch value for X-Content-Type-Options.name: patch_value_for_x_content_type_options

actions.description: Delete a runtime policy given its ID
actions.verbose: Delete a runtime policy given its ID.

policy_id.description: Unique Identifier for the policy.  The policy id is received in the response after the policy is created or listed.
policy_id.name: policy_id

actions.description: Retrieve details of a specific policy using its ID
actions.verbose: Retrieve details of a specific policy using its ID

policy_id.description: Unique Identifier for the policy.  The policy id is received in the response after the policy is created or listed.
policy_id.name: policy_id

actions.description: Fetch and display all existing policies
actions.verbose: Fetch and display all existing policies.

actions.description: Update an existing policy given its ID
actions.verbose: Update status, action, tier, or application ID of an existing policy. Policy type cannot be changed

policy_id.description: Unique Identifier for the policy.  The policy id is received in the response after the policy is created or listed.
policy_id.name: policy_id

application_id.description: Application that includes the tiers or services on which you require to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
application_id.name: application_id

tier_id.description: Application-specific tier to apply the policy. Default value is "all"
tier_id.name: tier_id

default_action.description: Default action for this policy. You can select IGNORE for no notifications for the runtime activity; select DETECT to detect the runtime activity; select BLOCK to block a specific runtime activity. Default value is "DETECT"
default_action.name: default_action

enable_policy.description: Select Yes/No to enable/disable the policy
enable_policy.name: enable_policy

actions.action: add a rule to command execution policy
actions.description: Add a rule to the command execution policy to detect, ignore or block the runtime activity
actions.verbose:
Add the rules based on your requirement. The action that you specify within the rule supersedes the default action specified in Default Action.
You can select Ignore for no notifications for the runtime activity; select Detect to detect the runtime activity; or select Block to block the runtime activity.

policy_id.description: Unique Identifier for the policy.  The policy id is received in the response after the policy is created or listed.
policy_id.name: policy_id

action.description: Action to be taken if the filter matches
action.name: action

actions.description: Add a rule to the filesystem access policy to detect, ignore or block the runtime activity
actions.verbose:
Add the rules based on your requirement. The action that you specify within the rule supersedes the default action specified in Default Action.
You can select Ignore for no notifications for the runtime activity; select Detect to detect the runtime activity; or select Block to block the runtime activity.

policy_id.description: Unique Identifier for the policy.  The policy id is received in the response after the policy is created or listed.
policy_id.name: policy_id

action.description: Action to be taken if the filter matches
action.name: action
